recipes.db_sqlserver::do_restore_master: Restore all databases from a backup directory.
recipes.db_sqlserver::do_load_demo: Loads the demo database from a cookbook-relative directory.
recipes.db_sqlserver::do_backup: Backs up all non-system SQL Server databases to a backup directory.

db_sqlserver\/server_name.description: The network name of the SQL Server instance used by recipes.

db_sqlserver\/database_name.description: The name of a database running on this SQL Server instance

db_sqlserver\/restore\/database_restore_.description: The local drive path or UNC path to the directory containing existing SQL Server database backup (.bak) files to be restored. Note that network drives are not supported by SQL Server.

db_sqlserver\/backup\/database_backup_di.description: The local drive path or UNC path to the directory which will contain new SQL Server database backup (.bak) files. Note that network drives are not supported by SQL Server.

name: db_sqlserver
long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Configures a SQL Server database.

= REQUIREMENTS:

* Currently only works with EBS Volumes attached to server which are used as backup/restore directories.

= ATTRIBUTES: 

See metadata.rb

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate with the following run order:

Boot Scripts
  * do_load_demo - Loads an inital database image.

Operational Scripts
  * do_restore_master - Restores the database from the most recent backup EBS volume.
  * do_backup - Backs up the binary DB contents to an EBS volume.
  * do_drop_database - Drops the given database.
  
Decommission Scripts
  * do_backup - Performs final backup of DB contents to an EBS volume.
